Article Title: PM Modi expresses concern, says stand in solidarity with Iranians
Article Text: PM Narendra Modi expressed solidarity with the people of Iran as he said he was deeply concerned by reports regarding Iran Prez Ebrahim Raisi's helicopter flight that crashed in Iran's East Azerbaijan province. "We stand in solidarity with the Iranian people in this hour of distress, and pray for the well-being of the president and his entourage," he said in a post on X late on Sunday, amid fears that Raisi may not have survived the crash.Modi had last met Raisi on the margins of the Brics summit in Johannesburg in Aug 2023. The two leaders had discussed ways to strengthen bilateral cooperation in various fields, including trade and investment, connectivity , energy and counter-terrorism. Iran, along with five other countries, had joined the group in that summit. Raisi had congratulated Modi on the success of Chandrayaan mission and thanked him for India's support for Iran's Brics membership.In line with the ongoing high-level exchanges, which aided India's delicately balanced approach to the Israel-Hamas conflict, foreign minister S Jaishankar had travelled to Iran in Jan for talks with his counterpart Amir Abdollahian, who too was in the same chopper as Raisi.Raisi had also been looking to intensify engagement with India on the Chabahar port. He and Modi wanted to strengthen cooperation to realise the full potential of Chabahar port as a connectivity hub. Apart from the focus on connectivity initiatives, India and Iran have also worked in the recent past to ramp up political cooperation and strong people-to-people ties.In their meeting in Aug, they had decided to fast-track infrastructure cooperation, including the Chabahar project. The two also exchanged views on regional developments, including Afghanistan where both countries are working to ensure the Taliban don't allow terrorist groups to target any country. Raisi spoke again on phone with Modi in Nov to emphasise the need for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza.
Article Summary: PM Narendra Modi expressed solidarity with the people of Iran as he said he was deeply concerned by reports regarding Iran Prez Ebrahim Raisi's helicopter flight that crashed. The two leaders had discussed ways to strengthen bilateral cooperation in various fields, including trade and investment, connectivity, energy and counter-terrorism.

Article Title: Jammu drowning: 2nd body recovered from Tawi
Article Text: JAMMU: J&K police recovered the body of another youth on Sunday, a day after it fished out his friend’s body from Tawi river in Kishanpur-Manwal area, on the outskirts of Jammu. Both had drowned in the river where they had gone for bathing on May 17.Passersby found the clothes of Rajinder Singh (19) and Abhikash Singh (23) on the riverbank and alerted police.After receiving the information, police, along with SDRF and NDRF, launched a search and rescue operation. The body of Rajinder was recovered on Saturday."In addition to J&K police, SDRF and NDRF, 09 Para unit of Army also joined the search and rescue operation today to locate Abhikash," police said."After hectic efforts, his body was fished out today," police said, adding that investigation has been initiated to ascertain the cause of deaths.
Article Summary: J&K police recovered the body of another youth on Sunday, a day after it fished out his friend’s body from Tawi river. Both had drowned in the river where they had gone for bathing on May 17. Passersby found the clothes of Rajinder Singh (19) and Abhikash Singh (23) on the riverbank.

Article Title: Search near Pakistan border in J&K after 3 armed men spotted
Article Text: JAMMU: Security forces launched Sunday a widespread search near the India-Pakistan border in Kathua district of J&K to track down three armed men spotted in the hilly and wooded terrain late Saturday night, raising suspicion that those could be Pakistani terrorists on the run following a fatal ambush on a two-truck IAF convoy in Poonch district on May 4.Corporal Vikky Pahade died in the attack, while four of his IAF colleagues were wounded.Officials said a special police officer (SPO) reported seeing three men carrying weapons and backpacks in Tarnah nallah near Jangi Chak in Hiranagar sector. Military drones and dogs were deployed during the search. However, there has been no breakthrough so far. “Nothing suspicious was found so far, but the operation is ongoing,” an official said.Security measures have been intensified with increased vehicle and individual checks, particularly on border roads in the district.Earlier, extensive search operations were conducted after villagers in Jakhole-Juthana forest area of Kathua district reported seeing five to six armed men on May 14. On May 11, J&K police released sketches of six foreign terrorists.According to official sources, former Pakistani army SSG commando turned Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) operative Illiyas Fauji along with two other terrorists from Pakistan — Abu Hamza and Handoon — were identified as kingpins of the attack on IAF personnel. It suspected that Pakistani terrorists were also involved in the murder of a village defence guard in a gunfight in Basantgarh on April 28.
Article Summary: Three armed men spotted in the hilly and wooded terrain late Saturday night. Military drones and dogs were deployed during the search. Officials said a special police officer (SPO) reported seeing three men carrying weapons and backpacks in Tarnah nallah near Jangi Chak.

Article Title: EC transfers SP of Purulia, 3 others
Article Text: EC has transferred Purulia SP, Avijit Banerjee , five days ahead of polls in the district on May 25. Similarly, SDPO of Contai in East Midnapore, Dibakar Das, along with two officers-in-charge were also transferred. EC had received complaints against these officers, reported. An official said EC found that Purulia SP had played a partisan role and it also previously received similar complaints when he was SP of Diamond Harbour .
Article Summary: EC transfers Purulia SP, Avijit Banerjee, five days ahead of polls in the district on May 25. SDPO of Contai in East Midnapore, Dibakar Das, along with two officers-in-charge were also transferred.

Article Title: Labourers from Jharkhand killed, injured in Imphal shooting
Article Text: GUWAHATI: Unidentified assailants killed a 41-year-old migrant labourer from Jharkhand and wounded two fellow workers from the same state in a shooting around 8pm on Saturday in Imphal, marking the first instance of an attack on people from outside the Northeast since ethnic conflict erupted in Manipur in May last year.The body of the deceased, identified as Ram Hangsada, is kept at the morgue of Regional Institute of Medical Sciences in Imphal.Bittu Murmu, 22, and Mitalan Soren, 50, are recuperating at Raj Medicity in Imphal East, police said Sunday."The trio came from Godda district in Jharkhand. The wounded men's condition is stable," an officer said. Real estate developers and construction companies had hired them for a project. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack, said the officer."The shooting occurred outside their rented accommodation. Locals rushed to the area immediately after hearing gunshots and found a body and the two men on the ground," the officer said. According to sources, the assailants dragged the labourers out before shooting them at close range. Police have registered a suo motu case.
Article Summary: Unidentified assailants killed a 41-year-old migrant labourer from Jharkhand. Two fellow workers from the same state were wounded in the shooting. It is the first instance of an attack on people from outside the Northeast since ethnic conflict erupted in Manipur in May last year.

Article Title: West Bengal Raj Bhavan staffers defy summons, get police notice
Article Text: KOLKATA: The 3 Raj Bhavan employees summoned at Kolkata's Hare Street police station on Sunday did not turn up, prompting police to issue a notice asking them to present themselves on Tuesday.Police said they didn't get any communication from them. Though reports indicated that at least one of them had left Kolkata, police refused to confirm or deny it.On Thursday, Raj Bhavan special secretary S S Rajput and contractual employees Kusum Chetri and Sant Lal were booked for allegedly restraining a contractual employee who accused governor C V Ananda Bose of molesting her.A CCTV grab showing an accused woman carrying a bag belonging to the complainant has helped firm up the evidence, said police.
Article Summary: The 3 Raj Bhavan employees summoned at Kolkata's Hare Street police station on Sunday did not turn up, prompting police to issue a notice asking them to present themselves on Tuesday. Police said they didn't get any communication from them. Though reports indicated that at least one of them had left K Bengal, police refused to confirm or deny it.

Article Title: Pole collapses, falls on running train; 3 passengers injured
Article Text: RAIPUR: Three passengers, including a child, were injured when a trackside pole collapsed and struck the 18030 Shalimar-Lokmanya Tilak Express near Raipur on Sunday morning.The accident was caused by "unauthorized" drilling by Chhattisgarh State Electricity Board ( CSEB ) near the railway line, said officials.CSEB denied that the work was unauthorized.The train was passing through Urkura station, around 10km from Raipur, when the pole fell on the train, smashing a window of an AC coach and injuring three passengers, one of them identified as Soumya Mondal.Railway officials sent an ambulance with doctors to the accident site within five minutes, said officials."First-aid was given to the passengers and they were taken to a private hospital in Raipur. All of them are out of danger," said an official.According to sources, a contractor of CSEB told labourers to drill underneath the railway line .As a result of the accident, Shalimar Express was held up at Raipur for about an hour.RK Shukla, managing director of CSEB, said the work was being carried out by a CSEB contractor, and a "collaborative survey" was carried out before it started.
Article Summary: Three passengers, including a child, were injured when a trackside pole collapsed and struck the 18030 Shalimar-Lokmanya Tilak Express. The accident was caused by "unauthorized" drilling by Chhattisgarh State Electricity Board ( CSEB ) near the railway line, said officials.

Article Title: Man assaulted for 'cattle smuggling'
Article Text: One person was arrested on charge of thrashing a 60-year-old man on suspicion of cattle smuggling in Jharkhand on Sunday, police said. It is alleged Saraswati Ram was also stripped and dragged from a motorcycle. The SP said raids are under way to nab two other accused.
Article Summary: It is alleged Saraswati Ram was also stripped and dragged from a motorcycle. The SP said raids are under way to nab two other accused. The 60-year-old man was thrashed on suspicion of cattle smuggling in Jharkhand.

Article Title: 3 days after couple found dead at home, no clarity on how wife died
Article Text: MUMBAI: : Three days after the bodies of an elderly couple were found at their house in Kandivali East, police concluded that the man died by suicide but the cause of death of the wife is still unclear. Pramod Chonkar, 61, was found hanging from the ceiling fan while his wife, Arpita Chonkar, 57, was found lying on the bed next to him. Both the bodies were decomposed when the police found them on May 16.According to the police, the couple resided at Arya Chanakya Nagar in Kandivali East.They were childless. Pramod had left behind a suicide note. Based on the contents of the note, police said the couple was feeling the pinch from a financial crunch ."We received a call from local residents about a foul odour emanating from the Chonkar residence on May 16. After breaking down the door, we found the two bodies and immediately moved them to a hospital. Both the bodies were decomposed. Pramod had left a suicide note dated May 14 in which he mentioned that he was dying by suicide," a police officer said.Autopsy examinations were carried out on the couple. While it was established that Pramod had died by suicide, there was no conclusion about Arpita's cause of death. "The viscera has been sent for forensic analysis to the state forensic science laboratory. As of now, an accidental death entry has been recorded. Further action will be taken on the basis of forensic reports," said the officer.Forensic experts will also look into the possibility of poisoning.
Article Summary: Pramod Chonkar, 61, was found hanging from the ceiling fan while his wife, Arpita, 57 was found lying on the bed next to him. Both the bodies were decomposed when the police found them on May 16. Pramod had left behind a suicide note.

Article Title: US & Iran held indirect talks in Oman: Report
Article Text: WASHINGTON: Senior US and Iranian officials held talks through intermediaries in Oman this past week, the first such conversations since Iran launched a retaliatory attack on Israel with hundreds of missiles and drones last month, according to a person familiar with the recent meetings.Brett McGurk, the top White House official on West Asia policy , and Abram Paley , the deputy special envoy for Iran, attended the talks in Oman.The goal was to try to get Iran, which supplies weapons and training to militias across West Asia, to move to rein in its partners. Since the Israel-Hamas war broke out, several Iran-backed militias in Iraq and Syria have stepped up attacks on US troops, raising fears of a wider war. The most powerful of the regional militias, Lebanon-based Hezbollah, has been exchanging fire with the Israeli military in northern Israel and southern Lebanon. However, US intelligence officials assess that neither Hezbollah nor Iran wants to engage in a wider war.The US has had no diplomatic relations with Iran since 1979, and discussions are often conducted through intermediaries and back channels.The format of the talks in Oman was similar to ones held in Jan: The Americans sat in one room while their Iranian counterparts sat in another, and Omani officials shuttled between the rooms.
Article Summary: Brett McGurk, the top White House official on West Asia policy, and Abram Paley, the deputy special envoy for Iran, attended the talks in Oman. The goal was to try to get Iran, which supplies weapons and training to militias across West Asia, to move to rein in its partners.

Article Title: Wrong implant inserted during arm surgery, says Kerala man
Article Text: KOZHIKODE: Another allegation of medical negligence surfaced at Govt Medical College in Kerala 's Kozhikode after the relatives of a youth alleged a wrong implant was inserted during a surgery of his fractured arm on Saturday. On May 16, a four-year-old girl scheduled to undergo surgery for removal of an additional finger in her hand was instead operated on her tongue.The Kochi youth who had the surgery Saturday fractured his forearm and dislocated a joint in an accident on May 12.His mother said one end of an inserted wire was protruding from his arm, arousing suspicion.Medical college authorities refuted the allegation of a wrong implant and negligence. "A plate was fixed on the broken forearm and a K-wire was inserted to the dislocated joint. The cut end of K-wire was left protruding and will be removed after four weeks," said Dr Jacob Mathew, head of the orthopaedic department.Police have, however, registered a case and said further action would be taken if a medical board finds negligence.
Article Summary: A four-year-old girl scheduled to undergo surgery for removal of an additional finger in her hand was instead operated on her tongue. The Kochi youth who had the surgery Saturday fractured his forearm and dislocated a joint in an accident on May 12. Medical college authorities refuted the allegation of a wrong implant and negligence.

Article Title: Stranded ship Dali that destroyed Baltimore bridge set to move Monday
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The Singapore-flagged stranded cargo ship Dali, which has been obstructing one of America's busiest ports for nearly two months since it collided with and demolished a bridge in Baltimore , will be removed on Monday, authorities announced.In this operation, a nearly 1,000-foot (300-meter) Dali container vessel will be transported to a marine terminal.This will also give a sight of relief to all the crew members who were also stuck in the ship.Since Dali crashed into a support column of the Francis Scott Key Bridge on March 26, the 20 Indians and one Sri Lankan on board had no cell phones as they were confiscated by the FBI and endured a series of controlled explosions to break apart a massive piece of bridge stuck atop the ship’s bow.After the FBI boarded the Dali and seized the seamen’s cell phones, a wave of anxiety permeated the ship, according to a joint statement from the Singapore Maritime Officers’ Union, which represents the ship’s officers, and the Singapore Organisation of Seamen, which represents the other crew members, as per CNN.Dali lost power before crashing into a support column of the Francis Scott Key Bridge, resulting in its collapse and the tragic deaths of six construction workers who were atop the major transit route.The accident prompted the closure of the port , although temporary channels have facilitated limited traffic in and out of Baltimore.Authorities overseeing the salvage operation stated that preparations for refloating the Dali would commence from midday (1600 GMT) Sunday, preceding its relocation during high tide on Monday, forecast for 5:24 am.Initially, divers will inspect the ship to ensure there are no obstructions, following last week's use of explosives by demolition experts to remove sections of the collapsed steel bridge trapping the Dali, which still houses its 21-man crew.Subsequently, salvagers will extract up to 1.25 million gallons (4.7 million liters) of water, previously pumped into the Dali for stabilization as ballast, before releasing its anchors and mooring lines.Tugboats will then tow the Dali at approximately 1 mile per hour (1.6 kilometers per hour) to a nearby marine terminal, with the journey expected to span three hours.Maryland Governor Wes Moore expressed to NBC News on Sunday his satisfaction with the progress, stating, "I'm proud that we're on track and by the end of May we'll have that federal channel reopened."Authorities have been tirelessly working to clear the collapsed bridge and resume waterway traffic, crucial for the port's operations as a key hub for the auto industry, handling nearly 850,000 autos and light trucks last year—more than any other US port, according to state data.In April, the FBI initiated a criminal investigation into the incident, with agents boarding the Dali as part of their inquiries.The National Transportation Safety Board, also investigating, disclosed on Tuesday that the ship experienced two electrical blackouts moments before the disaster. Additionally, the crew underwent multiple drug and alcohol tests, both before and after the incident, all of which returned negative results.(With inputs from agencies)
Article Summary: Singapore-flagged cargo ship Dali, which has been obstructing one of America's busiest ports for nearly two months since it collided with and demolished a bridge in Baltimore. The nearly 1,000-foot Dali container vessel will be transported to a marine terminal.

Article Title: France: Will quell New Caledonia riots 'whatever the cost'
Article Text:
What triggers the current unrest

(With inputs from agencies)

NEW DELHI: French security forces are intensifying efforts to regain control over New Caledonia, a French Pacific archipelago, amid ongoing and deadly unrest . Using armored vehicles and construction equipment , they have cleared nearly 60 barricades on the crucial RT1 highway connecting the capital, Nouméa, to the international airport, La Tontouta. Over 600 gendarmes have been deployed in this major operation, aimed at reopening the airport to commercial flights and restoring supply chains disrupted by the violence.The French High Commission in New Caledonia reported a relatively calmer night from Saturday to Sunday but still noted incidents of arson and looting.Authorities have imposed a state of emergency, a nightly curfew from 6 pm to 6 am, and granted security forces emergency powers, including house detention for those deemed threats and expanded search and seizure capabilities.After six nights of violence that have left six dead and hundreds injured, French government high commissioner Louis Le Franc warned in a televised address that new raids on independence strongholds would be staged."Republican order will be re-established whatever the cost," Le Franc said, adding that if separatists "want to use their arms, they will be risking the worst".French interior minister Gérald Darmanin, in a statement on social media platform X, affirmed the government's commitment to fully regaining control of the highway and stabilizing the region. The airport's closure since Tuesday has left thousands of tourists stranded, and the French government is coordinating with Australian and New Zealand authorities to facilitate the evacuation of their nationals once the situation allows.French President Emmanuel Macron has convened a series of emergency defense and security council meetings to address the crisis. The French government high commissioner Louis Le Franc has stated that "Republican order will be re-established whatever the cost," indicating a firm stance against the pro-independence militants responsible for the violence.The immediate trigger for the current wave of unrest in New Caledonia was the debate and subsequent approval of voting reforms by the French legislature in Paris. The National Assembly passed a bill that allows residents who have lived in New Caledonia for ten years to vote in provincial elections. This legislative change has been fiercely opposed by pro-independence supporters, particularly the indigenous Kanak population, who fear that the new rules will dilute their political influence in favor of pro-France politicians.Protests against these reforms began peacefully but quickly escalated into widespread violence. Demonstrators erected barricades, set fires, and engaged in armed clashes with security forces. The situation deteriorated further, leading to the closure of La Tontouta International Airport and significant disruptions to daily life and essential services across the archipelago.New Caledonia has a long history of tension between its indigenous Kanak population and descendants of European settlers. The archipelago has been a French territory since the mid-1800s, and its political landscape has been shaped by the ongoing debate over its status. While some factions seek full independence from France, others prefer to maintain ties with Paris.Indigenous Kanaks, who make up about 39% of the population, generally support independence, citing historical grievances, socio-economic disparities, and a legacy of segregation and discrimination. In contrast, the European-descended population and other non-indigenous residents tend to favor remaining part of France, benefiting from the economic stability and infrastructure support provided by the French government.The current unrest is the most severe in decades, reflecting deep-rooted divisions and the complexities of New Caledonia's political identity. The recent voting reforms have intensified these divisions, highlighting the challenges of balancing democratic representation with the protection of indigenous rights. As French authorities work to restore order, the long-term resolution of New Caledonia's political status remains uncertain, with significant implications for its future governance and social cohesion.
Article Summary: French security forces are intensifying efforts to regain control over New Caledonia. Six nights of violence have left six dead and hundreds injured. The immediate trigger for the current wave of unrest was the debate and approval of voting reforms by the French legislature in Paris. Some factions seek full independence from France, others prefer to maintain ties with Paris.

Article Title: Taiwan detects 6 Chinese aircraft, 7 vessels around its vicinity
Article Text: Taiwan's ministry of defense detected Chinese military aircraft and vessels near Taiwan, escalating tensions with China. People's Liberation Army, Air Defense Identification Zones, ROC Armed Forces, median line, Taiwan Strait, and grey zone tactics were involved. The increased presence of Chinese military assets near Taiwan underscores the ongoing geopolitical tensions in the region.

People's Liberation Army, Air Defense Identification Zones, ROC Armed Forces, median line, Taiwan Strait, and grey zone tactics were involved.
